intro: Diasperus rotundatus, commonly known as the roundleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are rounded and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and greenish-yellow. It is often used in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance.
